modules.description: Draws a regression plot from two lists of floating-point values, using the specified string as a title. Applies to paired numerical data for visualizing relationships between variables. Useful for quickly inspecting trends in experimental or statistical data.

This module offers utilities for file manipulation, text processing, numerical computations, and system interactions. It operates on strings, lists, arrays, files, and numeric types, enabling tasks like temporary file creation, line filtering, statistical analysis, and data serialization. Specific use cases include resource-safe I/O with channels, FIFO management, CSV export of numerical matrices, and environment-aware command execution.

This module implements linear regression training and prediction workflows using standardized input data. It provides functions to read and preprocess CSV data, compute standardization parameters, train models with optional debugging output, and serialize models to disk. Key operations include matrix parsing, feature normalization, model parameter estimation, and prediction on new input vectors.

This module supports end-to-end analysis of numerical data, from file processing and statistical computation to model training and visualization. It handles data in formats like CSV and numerical matrices, offering operations for normalization, regression, and prediction, along with utilities for file manipulation, filtering, and structured output. Users can load and preprocess data, train linear regression models, export results, and generate plots to visualize variable relationships. Example workflows include analyzing experimental data trends, building predictive models from CSV datasets, and automating data processing pipelines with temporary files and command execution.
